repnme.cdata!:
Bosnia and Herzegovina - Second Emergency
            Transport Reconstruction Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Overall, the project outcome was
            satisfactory, sustainability is likely, and institutional
            development impacts were modest. Lessons reinforce once
            again, that staff continuity greatly facilitate operations,
            of particular importance when unconventional government
            structures prevail, such as in Bosnia and Herzegovina. The
            establishment of Project Implementation Directorates, proved
            highly useful, particularly appropriate in emergency
            situations as this one, where implementation was critical,
            and institutional performance weak. Nonetheless, these
            arrangements should be transitory, to be integrated into
            established administrative structures later on. Questions
            arise on the efficiency of focusing on institutional
            development, when the main priority of emergency operations
            is emergency reconstruction, and, moreover, the assumption
            of decisions, and actions during project implementation,
            regardless of whether it is an emergency operation, or not,
            becomes further questionable when actually parliamentary
            action is required. Therefore, given the unpredictability of
            circumstances on emergency operations, it is thus implied
            that project design be limited to the utmost simplicity,
            focusing strongly on the central objective, i.e., physical
            infrastructure, though project concept, and definition calls
            for further analysis. But this does raise questions on the
            time needed for institutional reform, namely where should
            reform originate.

repnme.cdata!:
Bosnia and Herzegovina - Second Emergency
            Transport Reconstruction Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Second Emergency Transport
            Reconstruction Project has several main objectives: a)
            supporting fiscal and trade reforms; b) rehabilitation of
            the primary transport network country wide; and c)
            reconstruction of the remaining key transport links with the
            rest of Europe. The project consists of two components. The
            adjustment component will support macroeconomic policy
            reforms. The transport investment component will: a) carry
            out maintenance and reconstruction on the most critical
            parts of the transportation networks; b) supply equipment to
            restart transport operations; and c) ensure the
            sustainability of reconstruction activities by strengthening
            local institution and taking proper organizational measures
            to ensure operations efficiency.

docna.cdata!:
Bosnia and Herzegovina - Second Emergency
            Transport Reconstruction Project

display_title.display_title:
Bosnia and Herzegovina - Second
            Emergency Transport Reconstruction Project
